event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: The platform administrator should schedule a service action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: JTAG read or write failure to a specific chip.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
JTAG read or write failure to a specific chip.

The domain may be reset, platform may be reset, or platform may become unbootable.

The resources associated with the chip will be deconfigured.

If this fault occurs while the platform is powering up or while a FRU is powering up,
then the FRU with the chip will not be configured into the system.
Otherwise, no immediate action is taken.



   SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:

      The XCSFU accesses the following ASIC using JTAG:

         JSC chips on Motherboards.

       If the chip being accessed is a JSC chip , then the platform will become unbootable.



   SPARC Enterprise M4000 platform:


      The XCSFU accesses the following ASIC's using JTAG:

         CPU chips on CPUM's;
         SC chips on Motherboards.

         
      If the chip being accessed is a CPU chip, then the CPU chip is deconfigured
      after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or
      after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


      If the chip being accessed is a SC chip, then the domains will not be allowed
      to reboot and system will gradually become unusable.

   

   SPARC Enterprise M5000 platform:


      The XCSFU accesses the following ASIC's using JTAG;

         CPU chips on CPUM's;
         SC chips on Motherboards.
      

      If the chip being accessed is a CPU chip, then the CPU chip is deconfigured
      after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or
      after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


      If the chip being accessed is a SC chip, then one-half of the Motherboard
      with the chip will gradually be deconfigured and the domains will not be allowed
      to use XSB's on one half Motherboard, after the platform is power cycled or
      after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.

 

   SPARC Enterprise M8000 platform:


      The XCSFU accesses the following ASIC's using JTAG:

         CPU chips on CPUM's;
         SC chips on CMU's;
         XB chips on BP_A Backplane;
         Clock chips on BP_A Backplane.
      

      If the chip being accessed is a CPU chip, then the CPU chip is deconfigured
      after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or
      after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


      If the chip being accessed is an SC chip, then the CMU will gradually be deconfigured
      and domains will not be allowed to use XSB's on this CMU
      after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or
      after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


      If the chip being accessed is an XB chip, then the Crossbar way
      with this XB chip is deconfigured the next time the platform is restarted.

         If this is the first crossbar way being deconfigured,
         then the platform will operate with reduced performance.

         If a crossbar way has already been deconfigured,
         then the platform will be powered down.


      If the chip being accessed is a CLK chip, then the platform cannot be restarted
      after the next platform reset or power-off.




   SPARC Enterprise M9000 platform:


      The XCSFU accesses the following ASIC's using JTAG:

         CPU chips on CPUM's;
         SC chips on CMU's;
         XB chips on XBU's;
         Clock chips on Clock Unit (CLKU).
      

      If the chip being accessed is a CPU chip, then the CPU chip is deconfigured
      after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or
      after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


      If the chip being accessed is an SC chip, then the CMU will gradually be deconfigured
      and domains will not be allowed to use XSB's on this CMU
      after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or
      after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


      If the chip being accessed is an XB chip, then the Crossbar way
      with this XB chip is deconfigured the next time the platform is restarted.

         If this is the first crossbar way being deconfigured,
         then the platform will operate with reduced performance.

         If a crossbar way has already been deconfigured,
         then the platform will be powered down.


      If the chip being accessed is a Clock chip, then

         If this is the active CLKU,
         then the CLKU is deconfigured the next time the platform is restarted.

         If this is the standby CLKU, the CLKU is deconfigured immediately.
 

The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 27 15:00:39 nwk-dc2-1-sc0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: nwk-dc2-1  
   EVENT-ID: c145da9b-cbc2-4391-b1e4-efb64ce52c07
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8002-JJ for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8002-JJ, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 15:00:39 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: nwk-dc2-1, HOSTNAME: nwk-dc2-1-sc0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: c145da9b-cbc2-4391-b1e4-efb64ce52c07
   DESC: JTAG read or write failure to a specific chip.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8002-JJ for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: The resources associated with the chip will be deconfigured.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   IMPACT: The platform may be reset or a domain may be reset. The platform may be unable to restart.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   REC-ACTION: The platform administrator should schedule a service action to replace
   the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be
   determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command
 

   SPARC Enterprise platform example:

   xscf> fmdump -v -u c145da9b-cbc2-4391-b1e4-efb64ce52c07

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 27 15:00:39.3234 c145da9b-cbc2-4391-b1e4-efb64ce52c07 SCF-8002-JJ
           100%  fault.chassis.jtag.device

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/clku=0/clk=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/clku=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=nwk-dc2-1:
                             server-id=nwk-dc2-1-sc0:serial=PP0638K200:
                             part=CA06620-D321 A5:revision=0201/component=/CLKU_B#0


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The platform may be reset or a domain may be reset. The platform may be unable to restart. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The resources associated with the chip will be deconfigured. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: JTAG read or write failure to a specific chip.
